Data: Siddle to Pietersen, 1 bye oh dear - a big inswinger down the leg side and Haddin palms it to fine-leg
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run on his legs, tries to whip through midwicket but can't get bat on ball - an intrinsic necessity of batting
Siddle to PD Collingwood, 1 run flicked to leg, they steal a single and will have to hurry - throw hits the stumps but Pietersen's quick, limp or no limp, and there's England's 200
Siddle to Pietersen, no run good, inswinging yorker dug out nicely. Pietersen picks up the ball and throws it back to the bowler - second time he's done that today
Siddle to Pietersen, no run elegantly driven to mid-off
Siddle to Pietersen, 2 runs swung into Pietersen's pads who stood tall and commandingly flipped it through midwicket. A wonderful stroke but it's cut off on the boundary
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, 1 run down the leg side and nudged for a single behind square
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, (no ball) well wide of the off stump, and the ninth no-ball of the day
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, 1 run outside off, drives cautiously out to deep extra cover
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run Collingwood goes back, plants his feet and chops out to the off side. Ugly stroke
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run nice shape away from the right-hander
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run blocked solidly off the back foot
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, no run left alone outside off
Siddle to Pietersen, no run banged powerfully back to the bowler
Siddle to Pietersen, no run swings away from Pietersen who shoulders arms
Siddle to Pietersen, no run bounce for Siddle but wide of the off stump
Siddle to Pietersen, (no ball) 1 run the inswinger and nicely clipped by Pietersen down to fine leg
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run that's a good line to Collingwood, just outside off and he plays it solidly out to the off side
Siddle to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs streaky! Not in total control of that, driving it and getting the thickest of edges wide of where a gully might have been placed. Just one slip in place...
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run blocked on the front foot
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run goodish line and length but no swing. Left alone
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run well wide of the off stump, cuts further away and it's ignored
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run again, wide of the off stump. That seems to be the tactic here

Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, FOUR runs fantastic shot. Wide of the off stump and somehow Pietersen threads it through extra cover, in spite of the packed off-side field, flinging his hands at it and timing it massively. Top, top shot!
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run ignored outside off

Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run inswinging yorker - that's damn close! Quick delivery and the ball balloons to the slips who appeal for both lbw and a catch. That is so, so close! It looked like he got an edge, onto his boot, and the lbw
Siddle to PD Collingwood, 1 run flicked to leg
Siddle to Pietersen, no run pushed out to the off side
Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run short and pulled to deep midwicket
Siddle to PD Collingwood, 4 leg byes four more - a stray down the leg side. Poor ball, unable to control the inswing
Siddle to PD Collingwood, FOUR runs ah, poor ball. Really poor delivery, short, wide and cut with power for four
Siddle to PD Collingwood, no run defended solidly
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run laced it but extra cover fields it smartly
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, 3 runs another commanding flick through the leg side. Not quite the Pietersen Flamingo Flick (? Pietersen 2006) but smart nevertheless
Hilfenhaus to PD Collingwood, OUT got him - what a catch by Haddin diving to his right! Just outside the off stump, Collingwood edged it and Haddin moved a little late, but clung on with both hands
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run cuts away from Prior who leaves it alone
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run Prior shuffles across to the off side and defends, solidly
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run good, quick yorker on the off stump
Siddle to Pietersen, no run wide of the off stump
Siddle to Pietersen, no run a rip-snorting jaffer moving away from Pietersen and beating his drive. Super ball!
Siddle to Pietersen, no run and this one holds its line, Pietersen again beating playing inside the line. This is great stuff from Siddle
Siddle to Pietersen, no run defended chippily back to the bowler
Siddle to Pietersen, no run on the back foot, played back to the bowler
Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run sat up nicely and he pulled it massively, but straight to deep square leg

Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run flayed and is that dropped? Clarke at short extra cover and he dived forward and to his right...but couldn't cling on. It was a real grass-cutter - only half a chance really
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run cuts away and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run wide of the off stump
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run wide of the off stump
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run blocked off the back foot. A touch of movement away from the right hander
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Siddle to Prior, no run just outside off, Prior guides it out to the off side
Siddle to Prior, (no ball) superb delivery! Cuts away markedly on the right hander who fishes and misses. Haddin loves it. So does Siddle. So do I. Fine delivery
Siddle to Prior, 3 runs classily driven off the back foot, though lacking perfect timing
Siddle to Pietersen, 1 run steps outside off and flicks to leg
Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs the inswinger and Prior gets bat on it. Well - he gets a lot of bat on it in fact, timed the underwear off it for four. That ball really is booming around
Siddle to Prior, no run more inswing and well defended on the back foot
Siddle to Prior, no run outside off and defended on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run classical off-drive to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, 2 runs inside edge past his stumps! He was really late on that and it could've easily knocked out his leg stump
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run driven on the walk to mid-off
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run left alone outside off
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run flicked to leg
Hilfenhaus to Pietersen, no run cuts back and defends
Hauritz to Prior, no run pushed out to the off side
Hauritz to Prior, no run turns back sharply into Prior who defends
Hauritz to Prior, no run comes forward, defending to Katich at short-leg
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run quicker and fuller but Prior's still able to sweep

Hauritz to Pietersen, OUT got him! A terrible shot from Pietersen, trying to sweep this from miles outside off without getting down into position, and he top edges it meekly straight into the hands of a delighted Katich at short-leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run lunges forward and pushes it out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run chopped down to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run powerfully driven to cover - really strong defensive shot
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run late swing! Things are happening for Australia here, but Prior got a thick inside edge
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run defended on the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run defended again off the back foot, shuffling to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run very full but a little wide of the off stump
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run Flintoff lunges forward, like an old man leaning on his walking stick. He looks so ill at ease playing spin
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run onto the back foot and flicked to leg
Hauritz to Prior, 2 runs steps to leg and back-cuts it hard, extravagantly
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run tossed up on middle, elegant flick to leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, FOUR runs lunges forward and gets an inside edge - for four! Only Flintoff could manage that.
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run whipped to mid-on
Johnson to Prior, no run hooked for four - no! Short midwicket stopped it. That nearly killed him - Prior nailed it
Johnson to Prior, 1 leg bye turned off his pads
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run steps outside leg and flays it out to deep extra cover
Johnson to Prior, no run on middle, turned to leg
Johnson to Prior, no run Prior defends to leg
Johnson to Prior, no run short of a length and guided out to the off side
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run nudged to leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run on the sweep and powerfully struck
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run turned to leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, FOUR runs that's a lovely shot from Flintoff. Elegant, even. Poor ball outside off and Flintoff cuts it hard. Way, way too short
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run lunges forward and nudges to leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run defended on the front foot. My word, he looks so uncomfortable against spin...
Johnson to Prior, FOUR runs thick outside edge falls short of the slips and goes for four. Not a chance, it was played down and late, but still quite fortuitous
Johnson to Prior, no run slower delivery, punched to leg
Johnson to Prior, no run 89.9mph outside off, and it beats Prior's drive
Johnson to Prior, 1 run guided out to the off side, and guided powerfully too
Johnson to Flintoff, no run on middle, Flintoff is back and defending with the straightest of bats

Johnson to Flintoff, FOUR runs savaged through cover for four. Flintoff at his most caveman-like. Outside off and he plants his feet like an oil rig steadying itself in the north sea, then flays him for four. The ball bounces twice and t
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run Prior gives himself room, defending it with purpose down to long-on
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run left alone outside off
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run on the back foot, defended
Hauritz to Flintoff, no run defended - with a big grin
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run onto the front foot and flicks it through leg. Nicely played
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run flicked to leg
Katich to Prior, 1 run short and on his legs, Prior heavies it through midwicket
Katich to Flintoff, no run spins back sharply and pushes it out to the off side
Katich to Flintoff, no run comes forward, smothering it on the front foot
Katich to Flintoff, no run tossed wider of the off stump and left alone
Katich to Flintoff, no run full toss, patted to mid-off
Katich to Flintoff, no run spins back into Flintoff who defends on the back foot
Hauritz to Prior, FOUR runs a flat, powerful sweep for four! That was timed with great power. Hughes at deep midwicket couldn't save it - immense muscle in that shot
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run shorter delivery tucked to leg
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run tickled around the corner. Nicely played
Hauritz to Prior, no run tossed up on middle, Prior's forward, smotheringq
Hauritz to Prior, 1 run wide of the off stump, Prior gives himself room and pats it wide of point
Hauritz to Flintoff, 1 run fuller, almost a yorker, and it's bunted to Hughes at deep midwicket who receives ironic applause for fielding it cleanly this time
Katich to Flintoff, FOUR runs back-cuts short of slip - for four! Didn't carry, but well bowled
Katich to Flintoff, no run ooh quicker - well bowled! Flintoff's on the back foot and defends late
Katich to Flintoff, no run again on the back foot, he then prods forward
Katich to Flintoff, FOUR runs that's runs, that is. Tossed up, Flintoff waits for it and heavies it down the ground. Massive power down the ground - nearly cleans Prior up!
Katich to Flintoff, 1 run short of a length and pulled but mistimed
Katich to Prior, 1 run beautiful square drive, opening the face
Johnson to Prior, no run well wide - a wild and woolly delivery that swings late back into the right-hander, but only after pitching
Johnson to Prior, no run encouraging late swing into Prior - big swing, in fact. Prior defends
Johnson to Prior, no run a wild, wasted delivery miles wide of the off stump
Johnson to Prior, no run slashed to point, and only just short of Hussey
Johnson to Prior, 1 run outside off, defended nicely out to cover for a quick single
Johnson to Flintoff, no run solidly defended on the front foot
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 1 run late swing forces an error from Prior who tries to drive straight but gets a leading edge out to point
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run a touch of late swing but Flintoff shuffles across to defend
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run forward onto the front foot, takes a thick outside edge which falls short of second slip. Soft hands - well, soft for Flintoff anyway
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, 2 runs shorter ball and pulled to leg
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run comes forward to defend on the front foot
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, FOUR runs that's runs that is. Massive runs. Flintoff's most authoritative stroke today is pulled through midwicket with commanding power. Bosh!

Johnson to Prior, 3 runs gorgeous extra-cover drive - and they'll get overthrows too. Ponting distinctly, emphatically unimpressed by the backing up. The double teapot isn't yet out, but give it time...the crowd are just beginning to win

Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run onto the front foot and defended out to the off side - excellent running and they get a single. Flintoff's beginning to run Australia a little ragged here. It's an adventurous, cheeky innings
Johnson to Prior, 2 runs flicked to leg and placed for two

Johnson to Prior, 3 runs short of a length and pulled wide of mid-on, but not quite timed it as well as he might. Still - more aggressive intent shown by this pair, and the new-ball is flying all over the shop
Johnson to Flintoff, no run just outside the off stump and he laces it - absolutely murders it! - but straight to long-off
Johnson to Flintoff, 1 run nudged to leg and Flintoff retains the strike with a nudge to leg
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run a wild swing and a miss to an excellent, if slightly wide, outswinger
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run another very good outswinger is left alone
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, 1 leg bye down the leg side and it doesn't straighten as much as he'd like. Turned for a single
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 2 runs gorgeous extra cover drive, though it'll be cut off by the man on the boundary
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 1 run nudged to leg for another single
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run defended solidly to point
Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs don't bowl there to Prior. Back cut for four - super, controlled, elegant shot. He's so strong outside the off stump: as good as anyone
Siddle to Prior, FOUR runs exceptional, thrashing cover-drive for four! One of the shots of the day, opening the face and absolutely smiting it for four. Not a great delivery
Siddle to Prior, 1 run cuts it off the back foot, one hand coming off the bat
Siddle to Flintoff, 1 run a forcing, back-foot drive for a single
Siddle to Prior, 1 run cuts it out to the off side for his ninth Test fifty, and what an attractive knock that's been. Timely for England, too - and from 54 balls. Impressive
Siddle to Flintoff, no run Flintoff shoulders arms with extravagance outside off
Hilfenhaus to Prior, FOUR runs four more - but not convincingly. Thick outside edge flies past the slips down to third man. Everything's going England's way at the moment
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 1 run blocked out to the off side for a quick single
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run he's laced that, standing tall and driving it with ugly brute force, but mid-off does brilliantly, diving to his right to field
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, no run very late on this good, straight delivery and nearly gets a thin inside edge
Hilfenhaus to Flintoff, 1 run guides this out to the off side and Prior calls him through for a single - they'll have to be quick! Hilfenhaus screws up the fielding, however, and they're home
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run well bowled! A superb comeback! Outswinger beating the drive
Siddle to Flintoff, no run defended on the front foot, the ball balloons out to the off side and Flintoff hasn't a clue where it's gone
Siddle to Flintoff, no run defended on the front foot out to the off side. No chance of a single, though they think of it
Siddle to Flintoff, no run onto the front foot, defending solidly
Siddle to Flintoff, OUT bowled him! An horrid, angled bat as he tries to drive but gets a thick inside edge which hammers into his stumps
Siddle to Anderson, no run shuffles back, defends just short of short-leg
Siddle to Anderson, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Hilfenhaus to Prior, no run brute of a delivery - a stunner! Late outswing away from Prior's drive
Hilfenhaus to Prior, 1 run more swing, but guided out to the off side for a single
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run big, booming inswing into Anderson, the left-hander
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run shuffles back and nervously turns it to leg
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run great delivery that cuts away at the last moment - that's brilliant from Hilfenhaus! Anderson, well, he hasn't a clue how to play that
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 wide wide - way, way too wide and it's eventually signalled as such by the umpire
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run left alone outside off
Siddle to Prior, no run comes forward, tries to defend but is beaten by outswing. Unlucky again for poor old Siddle
Siddle to Prior, no run smartly blocked off the back foot
Siddle to Prior, OUT inswing back into the right-hander and he's bowled him! A fantastic delivery by Siddle - huge, late inswing and it forces its way through Prior's gate
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs beautifully played. On the front foot, opens the face and defends it with an open face down to third man
Siddle to Broad, no run shorter delivery, Broad's back and defending off the back foot
Siddle to Broad, 1 wide wide again - well wide of the off stump. Ponting doesn't like it
Siddle to Broad, no run defended to backward point
Johnson to Anderson, no run Anderson cracks him powerfully off the back foot
Johnson to Anderson, no run Anderson steps to leg before guiding this off the back foot. Safely, comfortably played
Johnson to Anderson, 2 runs flayed out to the off side - timed that quite nicely, too. They only take two though
Johnson to Anderson, no run good, tight line on the off stump which is defended on the back foot out to cover
Johnson to Anderson, no run stroked confidently - elegantly, even - out to mid-off
Johnson to Anderson, no run on his legs, tucked behind square
Siddle to Broad, no run Broad shuffles back to defend with a straight bat off the back foot
Siddle to Broad, no run good line and length on off stump, Broad goes back to defend solidly on the back foot
Siddle to Broad, no run touch too wide - a nice early-morning sighter for Broad
Siddle to Broad, no run on the back foot, he's defending crisply off the back foot
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs my word. That's a beautiful shot - the most orthodox and creamy cover drive rockets across the turf for four. Superb shot
Siddle to Broad, no run better line and defended on the back foot
Johnson to Anderson, 3 runs have some of that! That's the way tailenders should play. Short, wide and he clatters it over point. It's slightly mistimed, but an encouraging sign of intent
Johnson to Broad, no run that's a snorter from Johnson - a real jagging, cutting, viper of a delivery that shot back off the seam and cut Broad in half
Johnson to Broad, no run defended on the back foot
Johnson to Broad, 2 runs that's well played, forcing this good length delivery off the back foot
Johnson to Broad, 1 run inside edge! That could've gone anywhere and very nearly destroyed Broad's stumps
Johnson to Anderson, no run steps to leg and tries to clout him through extra cover but mistiming it
Siddle to Broad, no run plays and misses outside off - very fine delivery, holding its line
Siddle to Broad, FOUR runs thick outside edge, but played with soft hands and he'll get four for that. Not totally in control of that...
Siddle to Broad, no run better. Onto the front foot and he defends
Siddle to Broad, no run shuffles back and leaves it outside off
Siddle to Broad, no run firmly blocked off the back foot
Johnson to Anderson, no run short of a length, Anderson rocks back and gives himself room while defending chippily out to the off side
Johnson to Anderson, no run good take - great snaffle by Haddin to a horrible stray from Johnson down the leg side
Johnson to Anderson, no run another loose one down the leg side at 92mph
Johnson to Anderson, 1 run nicely played, shuffling back and timing it past cover for a single
Johnson to Broad, OUT bowled him! Johnson gets one on target at last and bowls Broad off his pads and around his legs
Johnson to Swann, no run on leg stump and defended
Siddle to Anderson, FOUR runs thick outside edge flies down to third man for four! Only two slips in place and it flies past them for four
Siddle to Anderson, 3 runs shot from Anderson, flicking his wrists like Azharuddin (? Gnasher) through midwicket. Excellent running yields three
Siddle to Swann, no run better line and length, defended on the front foot

Siddle to Swann, no run very good line. Siddle's struggled against the left-handers this morning and looks more comfortable against Swann, who plays and misses to one that shoots a bit low. Very low, in fact
Siddle to Swann, no run that's a good nut too, cutting back sharply into Swann's pads
Siddle to Swann, 1 run attempts a booming cover drive but gets a thick inside edge. They scamper a single as though their lives depend on it. And in some ways, that's true
Johnson to Swann, no run nudged off his pads
Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs well played. Opened the face and played it carefully, watchfully past the slips for four. No third man...

Johnson to Swann, FOUR runs driven on the up for four! Take that! Johnson's not happy, winging down some verbal half-volleys which are probably wasted on Swann, who plays his cricket as though each match is his last. Cracking shot
Johnson to Swann, no run better ball on middle stump, shaping back, and it's defended
Johnson to Swann, 3 runs a short-arm pick-up over midwicket - England are flying here. 91mph on his legs and picked up cheekily
Johnson to Anderson, 2 leg byes ooh, that hurries him off the pads. But it flies through the slips! Johnson's close to blowing a gasket here, and the crowd are riling him and his team
Siddle to Swann, 3 runs classily driven for three. He's really timed that well, too! It's poor bowling again from Siddle, though - a floaty half-volley, and Swann is no mug with the bat
Siddle to Anderson, no run ooh edged, and just short of third slip. Better length from Siddle
Siddle to Anderson, no run excellent delivery, spitting up at Anderson who jumps back and defends on the tips of his toes
Siddle to Anderson, 3 runs another fine shot. Another poor delivery. Outside off, Anderson flays his hands at it and scorches it through cover
Siddle to Swann, 2 runs outside off, Swann briefly thinks he's Viv Richards and pulls it through midwicket, but mistimes it. Nevertheless, England are absolutely on a roll here. It's one-day cricket
Siddle to Swann, no run cracked to point
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run starts with a full delivery that's dug out
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 run smart cricket by Anderson, flicking it behind square for a single
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run cut out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 run on the front foot, driving, and opening the face behind square

Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run big shout - that's dead close as it moves back at the last moment but the umpire says no. How is that not-out? Pitched in line and looked like it was taking out middle-and-off
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run beaten by a brute which lifts and leaves him at the last moment
Hauritz to Swann, 4 byes huge turn, but down the leg side. Monty, are you watching? Swann has a wry grin as this one turns off middle stump and Haddin hasn't a chance
Hauritz to Swann, no run more massive spin - off the good part of the pitch, too, not the rough
Hauritz to Swann, no run tosses it up on middle-and-off and it spins into his pads
Hauritz to Swann, FOUR runs down the pitch and Swann clouts him over mid-on for four. The fielder gives chase but drags it over the line - excellent, aggressive cricket

Hauritz to Swann, FOUR runs lifts this down the ground but mid-on will pick it up. Er, or not! Siddle's not picked it up and it goes for four - he only had two metres to move. The wheels are rapidly falling off
Hauritz to Swann, FOUR runs reverse-swept for four more! Brilliant from Swann, and Australia are beginning to lose the plot. That's England's 400 up too
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run on the back foot, pushed out to cover
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 run powerfully forced off the back foot
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run swings back late into his pads
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 run too straight and worked for a single to leg
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run defended to cover
Hauritz to Anderson, 1 run skips down the pitch, tries to smack him over the top but gets a thick outside edge...which falls short of point. Australia can't catch a break this morning
Hauritz to Swann, 1 run swept ungainly - flicking it, not unlike Pietersen's horror-shot yesterday
Hauritz to Anderson, no run tries to smack him over midwicket but beaten by prodigious turn. Good stuff by Hauritz, giving the ball some air
Hauritz to Anderson, OUT down the pitch and he tries to lift him over mid-on but he can't - an easy catch for Hussey who jumps back and swallows it
Hauritz to Swann, no run
Hauritz to Swann, no run that is a magnificently odd shot from Swann, who switches around to become a left-hander and tries for a slog but misses
Hilfenhaus to Panesar, 3 runs a huge roar as Panesar clips one away off his pads and nearly gets a boundary but it's chased down just in time
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 2 runs and Swann lofts cleanly over mid-on, comes back for an easy two and keeps the strike
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run backs away and advances, swinging at one outside off stump and misses the lot
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 run that's a good yorker but well squeezed out by Swann and they scamper through
Hilfenhaus to Panesar, no run solid defence outside off from Monty, who naturally gets another big cheer
Hilfenhaus to Panesar, no run on line this time but a perfectly straight-bat defence from Panesar
Hauritz to Swann, 2 runs short, wide and cut out to deep extra cover
Hauritz to Swann, 1 run reaches forward and pats it out to cover
Hauritz to Anderson, FOUR runs goes down for a sweep - not sure he got bat on it, but it's fairly flying down to fine leg. It's signalled runs, so four more!
Hauritz to Anderson, 1 run another reverse sweep, this time from Anderson! Can't time it
Hauritz to Swann, no run Swann charges Hauritz but the bowler asks to be invoiced first, and it's padded away
Hauritz to Swann, 2 runs patted out to the off side
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 run flicked to leg
Hilfenhaus to Swann, no run down the leg side and worked off his pads
Hilfenhaus to Swann, FOUR runs four down the ground! Classy, orthodox loft over the top and it very nearly goes for six
Hilfenhaus to Swann, 1 leg bye worked off his pads for a single
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, no run attempted yorker but it's too full, too wide
Hilfenhaus to Anderson, 1 run shuffles back and forces him square
Hauritz to Swann, 1 run and he does want it, with a clip through leg, there was never two in that so Panear is on strike
Hauritz to Panesar, no run drifts it in nicely and Panesar defends
Hauritz to Panesar, no run a little turn now, edgily played away towards gully
Hauritz to Panesar, no run no run, straighter this time, strikes pad and bat outside off

Hauritz to Panesar, 1 run oh, that's almost the end! Hauritz drifts one a long way outside off, it turns and Monty does a KP there, trying to sweep and the top-edge flies just over the head of Michael Clarke at slip
Hauritz to Swann, no run big turn this time, jags back into Swann, who keeps it out

Johnson to Panesar, 1 leg bye a big lbw shout from Johnson with a yorker that cannons into Panesar's pad, it was on the full and struck on line with leg. Billy Doctrove thought it was sliding down leg, though Hawkeye disagrees
Johnson to Swann, 1 run pulled away confidently for a single
Johnson to Panesar, no run slower ball almost does for Panesar, he chips it towards mid on but just checks his shot in time and Katich running in can't get there
Johnson to Panesar, no run shortish outside off and comfortably left alone
Johnson to Panesar, no run safely left alone outside off once more
Johnson to Panesar, no run but he doesn't, Monty shoulders arms again

Hauritz to Swann, (no ball) 1 run caught off a no-ball! Swann advances, Aleem Dar calls no-ball, and the batsman chips into the outfield where the catch is taken at deep midwicket by North. Oh dear, Nathan Hauritz
Hauritz to Panesar, no run defended comfortably
Hauritz to Panesar, no run defended outside off again
Hauritz to Panesar, no run lbw shout here for a ball that drifts in from the around-the-wicket line. Not out.
Hauritz to Panesar, no run another big shout, the ball doesn't turn and the Australians think it's been edged behind. Aleem Dar disagrees.
Hauritz to Panesar, OUT that's the end of the innings, Hauritz gets his third with a ball that drifts in and Panesar gets a thick edge to second slip

So England finish with 435 and they'd be very happy with that result. The tail caused a few problems for Australia and put on nearly 100 this morning. Some quick runs from Graeme Swann, who ends up unbeaten on 47. The Australians have an uphill
These two are ticking along nicely, the partnership has reached 61 without any real fuss
Panesar to Clarke, no run forward and off the pad safely
Panesar to Clarke, no run uses the feet well, then defends
Panesar to Clarke, no run down leg this time, Clarke opts not to sweep and prods it with a straight bat
Panesar to Clarke, no run sharp turn outside off but Clarke has no reason to play
Panesar to Clarke, no run much quicker delivery this time, 61mph or 98kph, right on line, but Clarke is up to the task and defends
Panesar to Clarke, 2 runs clipped away through leg
Swann to North, no run turn and bounce from Swann, who is coming around the wicket, and North leaves
Swann to North, no run defends this one on off stump
Swann to North, no run drift in from Swann, but North watches it closely and blocks
Swann to North, no run flatter this time and North punches to cover, can't beat the fielder
Swann to North, no run tossed up, inviting North to drive, but he leaves it alone just outside off
Swann to North, no run inside-edge onto pad, well wide of the man at short leg
Panesar to Clarke, no run drifts in and Clarke gets to the pitch, then drives straight to mid on
Panesar to Clarke, no run prodded away defensively
Panesar to Clarke, no run Clarke advances, then lets it strike him on the pad
Panesar to Clarke, no run cut away to point, Clarke annoyed that he couldn't find the gap
Panesar to Clarke, 1 run a bit too short, Clarke goes back and cuts out to deep point
Panesar to North, no run North walks across outside off and defends
Swann to Clarke, no run advances and drives, but can't beat the field
Swann to Clarke, no run again Clarke gets to the pitch and defends
Swann to Clarke, no run tucked away to leg
Swann to Clarke, no run quicker ball, Clarke is forward to defend
Swann to Clarke, 1 run driven wide of mid-off and Clarke gets a single
Swann to North, no run straight-bat defence from North
Panesar to Clarke, no run fullish length drifting in, Clarke drives to cover
Panesar to Clarke, FOUR runs that's a good pull from Clarke, he moved to come forward, then went back and Panesar dropped short, giving him the chance to go over midwicket with relative ease
Panesar to Clarke, no run Clarke thrusts the leg out to meet the ball
Panesar to Clarke, 1 run into the footmarks, turning in from well outside leg, Clarke works it behind square
Panesar to North, 1 run sweep from outside off stump, there's a man at deep midwicket
Panesar to Clarke, no run advances and clips to short fine-leg
Anderson to North, no run angled across North, who leaves
Anderson to North, no run solid in defence to a ball that doesn't move off the straight
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run angled across North and he lets it sail by
Anderson to North, no run prodded away to point
Anderson to North, 1 run flicked away off his pads for a run

Swann to North, no run close lbw shout here, drifting in and straightening, North looked up with a slightly concerned look, but he knew full well there was an inside edge and Billy Doctrove wasn't interested
Swann to North, FOUR runs well watched by North, he waited for that one and cut late, getting it away behind point
Swann to North, no run defends back down the pitch
Swann to North, no run North lunges forward and defends
Swann to North, no run no threat from that ball and North blocks
Swann to North, 1 run on the pads and worked away behind square
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run on the back foot, trying to punch through cover but mistimes it
Anderson to North, no run North shoulders arms again
Anderson to North, no run angled bat, defends towards gully
Anderson to North, no run Anderson just pushing it across North and there's no need for him to play, unless he really wants to, which he doesn' t on this occasion
Anderson to North, no run same ball, same leave, same result
Swann to Clarke, no run this one doesn't bounce much, turns in and Clarke punches to cover
Swann to Clarke, no run Swann is all twirl in the action and no spin off the pitch with that ball, Clarke drives to mid-off
Swann to Clarke, no run defends back down the pitch
Swann to Clarke, no run spins this one in to the body of Clarke, who lets it hit him
Swann to Clarke, FOUR runs good use of the feet once again, he gets to the pitch of the ball and drives wide of mid-off to bring up what has been a very solid half-century
Swann to Clarke, FOUR runs over the top this time, it ends up in the same spot running over the boundary wide of mid-off, good clean shot without any risk
Anderson to North, no run fullish ball on off stump, North strides forward and drives sweetly but Flintoff plods across from mid-off to save the boundary
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run angled across North and left alone
Anderson to North, no run North leaves this one alone as well
Anderson to North, no run wider ball now, left alone
Anderson to North, no run driven to point
Swann to Clarke, 1 run driven down the ground for a single
Swann to North, FOUR runs very confident sweep from North, he gets down and drags it from on off stump through midwicket and it races to the boundary
Swann to North, no run defended safely
Swann to North, no run no shot offered outside off
Swann to North, no run not much spin there, he leaves it
Swann to North, no run howzat, wonders Swann, not out says the Dominican Doctrove, who perhaps thinks there was bat involved or the ball was missing leg
Anderson to Clarke, no run left alone by Clarke, well judged
Anderson to Clarke, 1 run cracks this one to point and there's a misfield that allows a single
Anderson to North, no run pushed across North, who lets it go
Anderson to North, no run prodded back down the pitch
Anderson to North, FOUR runs a fine leg glance from North, who just helps it on its way and Monty Panesar running round from deep backward square lunges headfirst at the ball and fails to reel it in
Anderson to North, no run punched away safely
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run on line immediately, it stays low and Clarke defends
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run on the pads, Clarke prods it away
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run straight ball again, makes Clarke play, and he finds a gap wide of cover
PD Collingwood to North, no run left alone outside off
PD Collingwood to North, no run defends this one with a straight bat
PD Collingwood to North, 2 runs Collingwood is around the wicket here, North opens the face and guides it wide of the gully
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run shortish to start with, Clarke swivels it around to square leg
Flintoff to North, 1 run around the wicket to North, who clips it through midwicket
Flintoff to Clarke, 3 runs good shot from Clarke, he just gets into position nicely here and works it down towards long-on
Flintoff to North, no run no shot offered outside off, as is North's tendency
Flintoff to North, 1 run pushes this one to cover, who is a bit deep, so there's a quick single on offer
Flintoff to Clarke, FOUR runs cracking shot from Clarke, quickly onto a short one and pulls it in the air safely through midwicket, it races to the boundary and with that Australia have the lead
PD Collingwood to North, no run guided off the open face to the man patrolling a sort of short third man-cum-deep gully position
PD Collingwood to North, 4 byes well, that was almost an offspinner from Collingwood, it's hit the rough patch and turned past the bat, and also past the keeper's gloves, running away to third man

PD Collingwood to North, 4 byes and that's almost an identical result, it really is just a fast offbreak and Prior, who is up to the stumps, can't get behind it and this one runs finer to the boundary
PD Collingwood to North, no run North gets bat on ball this time and drives to cover
PD Collingwood to North, no run left alone outside off and gloved by Prior, who now has a helmet that wasn't protecting him before
PD Collingwood to North, FOUR runs that was a quicker one and North pounced, cutting it away behind point for a boundary that won't do Collingwood's confidence much good
Flintoff to Clarke, no run on line and defended by Clarke
Flintoff to Clarke, no run right in behind it again
Flintoff to Clarke, no run driven to short cover and can't beat the fielder
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run angled in towards leg stump, Clarke punches a drive just past the stumps at the bowler's end and Anderson does well at mid-on to make a diving save
Flintoff to North, 1 run angled in to the stumps, North simply prods to midwicket, who is so deep that there's an easy single
Flintoff to Clarke, no run solid in defence once again
PD Collingwood to North, 1 run another quick offspinner from Collingwood and North works it to square leg to bring himself within one of a half-century

PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run there's an lbw shout but Doctrove isn't interested. Another quick offspinner, Clarke thrusts the pad out without offering a shot but he was a long way outside the line and the ball would comfortably have
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run driven to midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run on line now, Clarke pushes to mid-on
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run another leg-thrust outside off stump, this time the ball sails through to Prior uninterrupted
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run nudged back down the pitch
Flintoff to North, no run North lets another one go through to the keeper
Flintoff to North, no run outside off, no movement off the seam and North lets it go

Flintoff to North, 1 run clipped off the pads behind square and that's a valuable half-century for North, who was under a bit of pressure in the lead-up until his big century against the England Lions
Flintoff to Clarke, no run pushed away towards cover
Flintoff to Clarke, no run driven away to cover and can't beat the field
Flintoff to Clarke, 3 runs punched away towards point
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run a slow normal-paced delivery on middle stump is blocked out
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run down the leg side
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run lunges forward to this little cutter, padded away - bat hidden behind the pad
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run slightly quicker and troubles Clarke on the front foot, who is hit on the pad
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run flicked to short midwicket
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run nicely stroked down the ground
Flintoff to Clarke, no run the most solid of forward defensives
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run flicked to leg
Flintoff to North, no run defended on the back foot
Flintoff to North, 1 run a handsome force off the back foot
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run opens the face and guides to point
Flintoff to North, no run half a shout but a) it's going down leg and b) it's much too high
PD Collingwood to Clarke, no run on the off stump and whipped to mid-on where Anderson does excellent work to prevent the single
PD Collingwood to Clarke, 1 run flipped in front of square
PD Collingwood to North, no run left alone outside off
PD Collingwood to North, no run slower ball, nicely bowled
PD Collingwood to North, no run again nicely bowled, drifting it into the left-hander
PD Collingwood to North, no run a huge, vociferous appeal from Collingwood! Was it bat-pad or pad-bat? Doctrove says no, but Collingwood's aghast
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run very straight and worked to square leg
Flintoff to North, no run firmly defended on the front foot
Flintoff to North, 1 run North is late on this defensive shot, rocking back and jabbing at it, getting a thick inside edge. Perfectly safe, mind, but he'll have woken up all of a sudden
Flintoff to Clarke, FOUR runs some stroke, that. That's quietened the crowd! The most orthodox of back-foot drives - so quick to dash back and drive it right at the top of the ball's bounce
Flintoff to Clarke, 2 runs short and pulled - Clarke had so much time. Panesar sprints round from fine-leg
Flintoff to Clarke, no run leaves this lifter outside off - the double arm-whirl from Flintoff there
Broad to North, no run left alone
Broad to North, no run squeezed out to the off side
Broad to North, no run left alone outside off
Broad to North, no run on the back foot, forces it out to the off side
Broad to North, no run driven out to the off side
Broad to North, no run good line outside off and it's left alone
Flintoff to Clarke, no run too wide and left alone outside off
Flintoff to Clarke, no run a little bit loose from Clarke, slapping outside off - kept just a little bit low
Flintoff to Clarke, no run that didn't keep low - absolutely flew through to Prior
Flintoff to Clarke, 1 run excellent shot. Confidently forward onto the front foot, pushing it out to the off side and calling North through for a single
Flintoff to North, no run North is right behind this on the back foot, head over the ball. Looks solid as a rock
Flintoff to North, no run leaves it alone outside off
Broad to Clarke, no run onto the front foot, Clarke defends
Broad to Clarke, 1 run fuller delivery on middle, flicked to leg
Broad to North, no run defends on the front foot, with a closed face of the bat
Broad to North, 1 run nudged out to the off side - good running
Broad to Haddin, 1 run short from Broad and fast, too, but Braddin's away with a flick to leg
Flintoff to Haddin, no run wide of the off stump and left alone
Flintoff to Haddin, no run defended on the back foot
Flintoff to Haddin, no run on the back foot, defends this excellent off-stump delivery
Flintoff to Haddin, 2 runs pulled around the corner
Flintoff to Haddin, no run yorker! Good ball, spearing in on the off stump but it's well dug out
Flintoff to Haddin, no run too wide and left alone
Broad to North, 1 run on his pads, flicked to leg
Broad to Haddin, 1 run too straight and Haddin gets an easy single to square leg. Broad simply has to attack Haddin's off stump yet give him width
Broad to North, no run good line and length but North is resolute in defence
Broad to North, no run well bowled. A little wider of the crease there and angles it into the off stump. Solidly defended by North, whose defensive technique has impressed all day
Broad to North, no run forward onto the front foot, and he defends
Broad to North, no run sways out of the way of a bouncer, but a fairly meek one
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run on the pads and Haddin clips it through midwicket to open the day
Anderson to North, no run pushed across outside off and left alone
Anderson to North, no run closer to off, North angles the bat and pushes to cover
Anderson to North, no run solid in defence, pushed to mid-off
Anderson to North, no run angled across from over the wicket and left alone
Anderson to North, no run defended to cover
Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs on the hips and clipped to fine leg for an easy four
Broad to Haddin, no run defended solidly to off
Broad to Haddin, no run pushed defensively back down the pitch
Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs so Brad Haddin's not going to hang around wondering, gets a bouncer from Broad and hooks in front of his eyes, a thick top edge flies over the keeper's head for four
Broad to Haddin, no run on the stumps and defended
Broad to Haddin, no run nudged to leg
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run defended away to cover
Anderson to North, no run angled across him again and North leaves
Anderson to North, no run on line this time, North defends
Anderson to North, 1 run shortish and North pulls it away through square leg safely
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run dropped into the off side and the fielder wasn't quick off the mark, lets the batsmen get through for a single
Broad to Haddin, no run on off stump and Haddin defends
Broad to Haddin, 1 wide short on off stump, Haddin thinks about hooking and then pulls the bat out of the way at the last moment
Broad to Haddin, 1 wide another bouncer, it's well over Haddin's head and Billy Doctrove calls it a wide
Broad to Haddin, FOUR runs that's a classy shot, a bit fuller and Haddin leans into a super cover-drive that races away to the boundary
Broad to Haddin, 1 run pushed away towards point and they get a single
Broad to North, no run fullish ball, North drives but can't beat mid-on
Broad to North, no run left alone outside off stump
Broad to North, 1 run that one keeps a touch low, North punches through off
Anderson to North, no run pushed away to cover
Anderson to North, no run nudged away to the off side again
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Anderson to North, no run almost some runs down the ground there, North drives off the front foot and Anderson in his follow-through kicks out the right foot and manages to stop the ball
Anderson to North, FOUR runs this one does get to the boundary though, shortish ball and there's no pace in the pitch, so North has loads of time to get into position for a pull through midwicket
Anderson to North, no run left alone outside off
Broad to Haddin, no run driven back down the pitch
Broad to Haddin, no run solid in defence again, Haddin resists the temptation to guide one through the vacant cordon
Broad to Haddin, no run watchful in defence once more, the ball isn't doing much at all here
Broad to Haddin, no run defended back down the pitch again
Broad to Haddin, no run blocked away again, that ball was 84.9mph or 136.7kph
Broad to Haddin, no run Haddin drives this one wide of the catching mid-on, but can't beat the man at a more regular, wider mid-on
Anderson to North, no run drivable length, so North drives, but straight to mid-off
Anderson to North, no run North shapes to pull this one, gets an inside-edge onto his thigh
Anderson to North, no run outside off stump and left alone
Anderson to North, no run angled across and North leaves
Anderson to North, no run around the wicket now, on off stump and North defends
Anderson to North, no run good ball to finish the over, on off stump, possibly a touch of movement away, and it beats North's outside edge
Broad to Haddin, no run Haddin gets right in behind this one and defends
Broad to Haddin, no run no swing, no seam movement, Haddin straight-bats it back to Broad
Broad to Haddin, no run this one keeps a touch low, defended again
Broad to Haddin, no run tries for a more authoritative drive this time but pinpoints Kevin Pietersen at mid-off
Broad to Haddin, no run clipped away to leg
Broad to Haddin, no run solid in defence once more
Anderson to North, no run on off stump, North is solid as a rock
Anderson to North, no run oh dear, that one must have stuck in the hand, Anderson tried for the offspinner-style slower and it's lobbed full and very, very, wide
Anderson to North, 2 runs on the back foot, North punches a drive on the up through cover and Cook's fielding almost has Haddin in trouble at the bowler's end
Anderson to North, no run angled bat and North defends forward of point
Anderson to North, no run pushed away defensively
Anderson to North, no run defended to off once more
Broad to Haddin, 1 run clipped away through leg
Broad to North, no run left alone outside off
Broad to North, no run angles in with the arm and North lets it go
Broad to North, no run North tries to slash a shorter one through point but doesn't get it off the middle, it slams into the turf
Broad to North, no run with such a strong off-side field, North, a very good on-side player, walks outside off and clips to leg, but can't beat mid-on
Broad to North, no run this one stays low and North leaves it
Flintoff to Haddin, no run big cheers as Flintoff runs in, Haddin bunts it back towards him
Flintoff to Haddin, no run Haddin drives but doesn't beat mid-off
Flintoff to Haddin, FOUR runs and that's what Haddin has been trying to do for the last couple of overs, punches an off-drive that runs between bowler and mid-off, where Broad's dive is in vain
Flintoff to Haddin, no run in behind this one to defend
Flintoff to Haddin, no run 85.6kph or 137.7kph, Haddin defends a straight one
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 run on the hips, Haddin clips it away to fine-leg
Broad to Haddin, 1 run flicked away to square leg for a run
Broad to North, FOUR runs now that is a great cover-drive from North, the off-side field is packed with seven men but he finds a gap and a diving Collingwood can't stop it
Broad to North, no run angled in from around the wicket but North leaves
Broad to North, no run left alone once again
Broad to North, 2 runs and now North uses the field to his advantage, takes it from outside off and works it wristily through square leg
Broad to North, FOUR runs it's all about placement here, North gets a shortish ball outside off and just opens the face to glide between the sole slip and gully for a boundary
Flintoff to Haddin, no run pushed back down the pitch defensively
Flintoff to Haddin, (no ball) 1 run short ball this time, Haddin swivels a pull through square leg
Flintoff to North, no run well bowled, North flashes outside off and Flintoff beats the bat
Flintoff to North, no run North takes a big stride forward and drives, straight to mid-on
Flintoff to North, no run angled in towards off, North defends
Flintoff to North, no run no shot offered to a ball that doesn't threaten outside off
Flintoff to North, no run tries for another cover-drive but this time can't beat Anderson at extra cover
Panesar to Haddin, 1 run down leg side, Haddin works a single to mid-on
Panesar to North, no run tosses it up and North drives to mid-on
Panesar to North, no run wider outside off, North waits on this one and tries to guide behind gully, but finds the man
Panesar to North, 1 run swept from outside off to deep square leg, where Bopara keeps it to a single
Panesar to Haddin, no run drifts it in to the pads, Haddin defends
Panesar to Haddin, 1 run shorter ball, Haddin works one through midwicket
Flintoff to Haddin, no run outside off, Haddin leaves
Flintoff to Haddin, no run angled in but still safely left alone
Flintoff to Haddin, no run no shot offered once again
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 run fuller ball, Haddin jams it to mid-on and gets a quick single, well run
Flintoff to North, (no ball) 1 run clipped away to midwicket
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 leg bye Haddin goes for a hook here, but doesn't get it off the middle, the ball bobs up but wide of Prior and fine-leg mops up
Flintoff to North, no run no shot offered outside off
Panesar to Haddin, no run not much turn there for Monty, Haddin defends
Panesar to Haddin, no run pushed to mid-on for no run
Panesar to Haddin, no run good ball this time, angled in, pitching and turning away to beat Haddin's outside edge
Panesar to Haddin, no run on line, Haddin blocks
Panesar to Haddin, no run defended back down the pitch
Panesar to Haddin, 2 runs delicately guided wide of slip, Haddin waited on that one nicely
Swann to North, 1 run tossed up outside off and it's driven to long-off
Swann to Haddin, no run and some genuine turn there from Swann, who jags one into the pads of Haddin and has an enthusiastic shout, but there was an inside edge
Swann to Haddin, no run Haddin advances and gets the pad in the way
Swann to Haddin, no run oh dear, that one almost gets through the gate! Big turn from outside off, Haddin lunges and tries to drive, the ball misses off stump
Swann to Haddin, no run tossed up nicely, Haddin drives to mid-off
Swann to Haddin, 1 run driven down the ground for an easy single to long-on
Panesar to Haddin, no run Panesar drifts it in from around the wicket, Haddin drives to mid-on
Panesar to Haddin, no run good ball, pitches on leg and straightens, Haddin is squared up in defence
Panesar to Haddin, 2 runs well worked through the vacant midwicket region there
Panesar to Haddin, no run almost sneaks one under the bat of Haddin, who just manages to jam it out
Panesar to Haddin, no run a bit of turn, Haddin defends, and Panesar jumps excitedly, for no apparent reason
Panesar to Haddin, no run on the legs, Haddin can't get it away
Swann to North, no run on off stump, a hint of turn, North defends but off a bit of a thick edge
Swann to North, 1 run driven uppishly through off, but safely out to cover for a single
Swann to Haddin, no run hmm, that's a good lbw shout, pitching outside off and turning in, Haddin is struck on the front pad, Aleem Dar thinks it struck him just outside the line, which it did
Swann to Haddin, no run another good ball, turns in and Haddin gets a thick inside edge onto the pad and it bobs just out of the reach of short leg
Swann to Haddin, no run driven back to the bowler
Swann to Haddin, no run bunted away to the off side
Panesar to North, no run outside off and left alone
Panesar to North, 1 run swept with force by North, but Bopara is patrolling the midwicket boundary
Panesar to Haddin, no run well flighted, Haddin drives on the up but it bounces safely short of cover
Panesar to Haddin, 1 run drifts onto the pads this time, Haddin clips it away through square
Panesar to North, no run almost! Panesar gets one in the footmarks outside off, North looks to drive but it turns sharply and hits him on the pad outside the line
Panesar to North, 2 runs paddle sweep from outside off stump this time, North finds a way to get a run down to fine leg
Swann to Haddin, no run some good turn here from Swann, but that was a bit too short and Haddin defends easily
Swann to Haddin, no run solid in defence again
Swann to Haddin, no run groans from England as Haddin gets another thick inside edge onto his pad, that was a very good delivery that jagged back in sharply
Swann to Haddin, FOUR runs well played this time, there's no slip and Haddin waited for the ball to spin in to him this time and simply opened the face and glided it down to third-man
Swann to Haddin, no run turns in sharply again and Haddin blocks
Swann to Haddin, no run solid in defence again
Panesar to North, 1 run good use of the feet from North, who gets to the pitch and works it safely through midwicket
Panesar to Haddin, no run Haddin plays with the straightest of straight bats

Panesar to Haddin, 3 runs worked off his pads this time forward of square and they do tremendously well to get back for a third, the outfielding wasn't shabby but North and Haddin were simply too fast
Panesar to North, 1 run prodded out to cover and again the running is good
Panesar to Haddin, no run Monty gives a bit of a grunt as he tosses this one up outside off, gets some turn but Haddin defends
Panesar to Haddin, no run forward in defence once again
Swann to North, no run on off stump, not much turn, North pushes it away
Swann to North, FOUR runs that's not North's prettiest shot but it was effective. Too short and wide, and North reached from his standing position to cut forward of point
Swann to North, no run pushed away safely again
Swann to North, 1 run a big backlift here as North gets this one on the full and drives expansively out to deep cover
Swann to Haddin, no run turns it in to Haddin's pads, he defends
Swann to Haddin, no run off the back foot and punched to the leg side
Panesar to North, 3 runs an enormous leap from Monty as North cuts it away behind point, no chance of a wicket, but my that was impressive how far off the ground Panesar lifted himself
Panesar to Haddin, 1 run Haddin gets into the cutting mood as well, just a fraction too short perhaps from Monty
Panesar to North, no run turns in a bit sharper this time, off the pads
Panesar to North, no run shouts of 'catch it' here as it bobs up off North's pad and towards slip, Collingwood actually spilled it but there was no bat involved anyway
Panesar to North, no run left alone outside off
Panesar to North, no run thoughts of a quick single there as North prods to off but Haddin is vociferous in his call of no
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 run that's a loosener from Flintoff, shortish outside off and Haddin punches through cover

Flintoff to North, FOUR runs not quite where North intended to play that one! He's shaped to cut, then he's tried to leave it and in the process it's somehow flown off the middle of the bat and between second slip and gully to get him i
Flintoff to North, no run solid in defence this time
Flintoff to North, 1 run wide outside off, North cuts it to the man at deep point
Flintoff to Haddin, FOUR runs and Haddin shows what he thinks of a new ball, backing away and giving himself room, one-day style, and he cuts it powerfully behind point
Flintoff to Haddin, no run good ball to end the over, some movement away, Haddin looks to play then decides to leave
Anderson to North, 2 runs on the pads, nicely clipped away through midwicket for a couple of runs
Anderson to North, 2 runs leg side again, North glances away behind square again, and he moves to 98
Anderson to North, 2 runs and there it is! Marcus North brings up his century by guiding a two behind point and dives back in for the second
Anderson to North, no run solid in defence, back on task immediately
Anderson to North, no run no swing here from Anderson, he's probably banging it in a touch too short, North defends
Anderson to North, no run on the pads, pushed back down the pitch
Flintoff to Haddin, no run no shot required, no shot offered outside off

Flintoff to Haddin, 1 run and Haddin gets in on the celebrations with a half-century. Very quick single pushed into the off side, the third umpire was called to check whether North diving in had his bat in the air, he didn't, and Haddin
Flintoff to North, 1 run Flintoff bangs it in and gets a riser into the gloves of North, who works it to fine leg
Flintoff to Haddin, no run no real swing here, Haddin drives to mid-off
Flintoff to Haddin, no run on line, Haddin prods it out towards cover
Flintoff to Haddin, no run pushed down to mid-on once again
Anderson to North, 1 run a leg-side line is clipped down to Swann who wings it in strongly
Anderson to Haddin, no run a sharp one from Anderson - brow still furrowed - swinging it back late on Haddin who himself was late on it
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run another inswinger, picked up by Haddin this time with one-dayish confidence, if not Twenty20 timing
Anderson to North, no run left alone
Anderson to North, no run late swing back into North! Good one from Anderson, darting it back at pace and North gets a thick inside edge into his pads
Anderson to North, no run dear oh dear, complete filth from Anderson there. Miles down the leg side
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 bye starts with a stiff shocker down the leg side. Prior does well to dive to his left
Flintoff to North, 1 run short, wide and crashed to deep backward point
Flintoff to Haddin, no run rocks back and guides it to point
Flintoff to Haddin, 1 run a mistimed flogging slog to mid-on
Flintoff to North, no run down the leg side
Anderson to Haddin, no run that's nicely bowled. Inswinging yorker, dug out
Anderson to Haddin, no run wild and woolly down the leg side. Again, a good stop by Prior to his left - his keeping has been relievingly anonymous this Test, so far
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs a rank long-hop is cut ferociously hard. As it should have been
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs edged and short of Prior! A false late-cut but falls just short of Prior who can only parry it for four
Anderson to Haddin, FOUR runs nonchalant! Rotten bowling from Anderson I'm afraid, but what a shot - on his legs, Haddin just walked into a flick over midwicket. Touch of Mark Waugh about that stroke
Anderson to Haddin, 1 run gives himself room, slapping it square
Swann to Haddin, 1 run flighted outside off
Swann to North, 1 run and there's Swann's hundred! Magnificent effort from the offspinner
Swann to Haddin, no run defended on the back foot
Swann to Haddin, SIX runs six! Big, big, lofted six over midwicket - he's connected with that magnificently. And there's Australia's 600
Swann to Haddin, no run down the leg side, appeal. Prior whips off the bails and appeals. Appealing all over the shop
Swann to Haddin, no run pushed out to the off side
Panesar to North, 1 run crashed out to the off side but just for a single. Monty'll have to wait...
Panesar to Haddin, no run what a ball - that turned and spat out of the rough, beating Haddin's massive swipe and flying to slip
Panesar to Haddin, no run squared up - lovely ball. Angled on leg stump and it turns away
Panesar to Haddin, 1 run again, another leading edge which flies out to the off side - and there's Panesar's hundred! An innings full of strays and not many edges. Well played sir
Panesar to North, FOUR runs big. Big! Swept over midwicket and deep midwicket is nowhere to be seen
Panesar to North, 1 run turned to leg for a single
Swann to North, no run North gives himself room, slapping to cover
Swann to North, 2 runs swept nicely down to fine leg
Swann to North, no run crikey - North gives himself room and tries to flang it over cover but misses. Prodigious turn
Swann to North, 3 runs beautiful little dab down to third man, and Monty receives the day's biggest applause for chasing after a red ball and winging in a throw
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs down the wicket and lofts it into the mass of space at midwicket
Swann to Haddin, 1 run quality - lovely little loft but just didn't time it sufficiently. Falls short of long-on
Panesar to Haddin, 2 runs flicked off his toes to square leg
Panesar to Haddin, 2 runs nicely played, skipping down the pitch and flicking it all along the turf
Panesar to Haddin, no run skips down the pitch to defend
Panesar to Haddin, no run skips down the pitch and pads away
Panesar to Haddin, no run again pads up
Panesar to Haddin, SIX runs superb shot. Down the pitch and smashing it over the top. Damien Martyn couldn't have played it better
Swann to North, 1 run outside leg and flogged to deep square leg
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs a delicate back-cut - or back-nudge - down to third man
Swann to Haddin, 1 run flicked to leg
Swann to North, no run defended back to the bowler
Swann to North, 1 leg bye goes for a reverse sweep, rapped on the pads but outside the line. And hit on the glove.
Swann to Haddin, 1 run tickled behind square for another single
PD Collingwood to Haddin, no run swings back late into Haddin
PD Collingwood to Haddin, no run shoots through low, turned to leg
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run flicked through midwicket and there's Australia's 200-run lead
PD Collingwood to North, 1 run pushed out to the off side
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run worked off his pads
PD Collingwood to North, 2 runs what on earth? That's cut off the pitch away from both batsman and wicketkeeper - must have hit a crack. England will be batting on this surface shortly...!
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs down the pitch and miscued over cover, but safely played
Swann to Haddin, 1 run worked to leg
Swann to North, no run waits for it on the back foot before dabbing it to short fine-leg
Swann to North, 1 run nudged around the corner
Swann to Haddin, no run elegantly driven but straight to short extra cover
Swann to Haddin, 1 run nudged to leg
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run worked around the corner
PD Collingwood to North, no run wide of the off stump and cutting wider still. Good take by Prior, low to his left
PD Collingwood to North, no run wide of the off stump and another excellent take by Prior
PD Collingwood to North, no run a solid defensive
PD Collingwood to North, no run firmly blocked
PD Collingwood to North, no run nicely bowled, nicely left outside off
Swann to Haddin, no run padded away
Swann to Haddin, no run what a ball that is! Spun back sharply on Haddin, through the gate, but missing the stumps
Swann to Haddin, 1 run comes forward and turns it with a flick of the wrists to the leg side
Swann to North, no run tossed up on middle. Defended
Swann to North, 1 run stroked to long-off
Swann to Haddin, 1 run Haddin jumps back and works it to leg, stealing the strike
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run flicked to fine leg and there's his hundred! Great celebration for a great hundred, an innings full of style, determination and elegance. Superb knock
PD Collingwood to North, 1 run nudged off his pads and there's Australia's 650. Six hundred and fifty for five. Good grief
PD Collingwood to Haddin, FOUR runs top shot! Half volley and he clubs it leg-side as though playing in a charity match
PD Collingwood to Haddin, SIX runs and again, but this time straighter, longer and with greater power! Schwing! Six over long-on
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 2 runs turned off his pads
PD Collingwood to Haddin, no run down the leg side and Prior appeals, appeals, appeals, and appeals some more! Not out, son.
Swann to North, 1 run worked away for a single
Swann to Haddin, no run turns in to Haddin, who defends
Swann to Haddin, no run thrusts his leg out to meet a non-spinner outside off
Swann to Haddin, no run driven to mid-off, it can't be long before Haddin goes aerial here
Swann to Haddin, 2 runs but first, an intelligent late cut helps it on its way for a couple down to third man
Swann to Haddin, 1 run he does go over the top now, down to long on and it's collected on the bounce
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run on the pads, Haddin clips it through the leg side
PD Collingwood to North, 1 run driven out through cover
PD Collingwood to Haddin, FOUR runs in the air, heaved over midwicket and Bopara running back can't quite make enough ground and it bounces over the rope. Typifies England's day, really
PD Collingwood to Haddin, 1 run flicked off his pads to square leg
PD Collingwood to North, 1 run soft hands there from North, just waits and guides it very fine to third man
PD Collingwood to Haddin, OUT and finally, something for the England fans to cheer. Haddin goes over the top again, trying for a six out to midwicket and Bopara takes the catch.

And with that comes the declaration. So Australia have played magnificently to build a lead of 239. North and Haddin were wonderful today. Now it's on England's top order to make the pitch look as placid as their Australian counterparts. Haddin
Match drawn
Player of the match is Ricky Ponting, AUS
